content.description: Climb the crack up until it takes a turn left horizontally, then turns again back up to the top.Moving left is the crux because it is surprisingly slopey in the horizontal crack.
content.protection: Easy and clean toprope setup on top with ~30' of cord using the trees as anchors.  Plenty of options for gear placements in the cracks if you lead it.  You might hit the tree if you fall in the first couple feet.
content.location: This small crag is right near the start of the Boulder Loop Trail.   This is on the one clean face, right next to the "Balls to Walls" boulder in the Tier 1 Left Side bouldering area.

content.description: Climbs the lightly featured slab face.  The tiny ridges and crimps are nice and grippy for your tips and toes.  There are a couple of shallow pockets (more like deep dishes really) to be found too.  A surprisingly fun climb that has a consistent "crap I could slip at any moment" feel to it the whole way up.Being taller makes a huge difference at the start.
content.protection: Easy and clean toprope setup on top with ~30' of cord using the trees as anchors.
content.location: This small crag is right near the start of the Boulder Loop Trail.   This is on the one clean face, right next to the "Balls to Walls" boulder in the Tier 1 Left Side bouldering area.

content.description: This is the short (25-30 ft) wall separating the tier 1 and tier 2 bouldering areas right near the entrance to the boulder loop trail.There is one face that is clean right now, with a couple of climbs.  There is the potential for more climbs to the left and right.
